> It’s odd that something which prevents the program from starting out of the box on Ubuntu when installed directly from Ubuntu is considered minor

This issue shouldn't in any way prevent Gazebo from starting out of the box. This issue has only 2 consequences:

1. Models can't be pulled directly from Ignition Fuel (beta feature)
1. An error message is printed:

```
[Err] [REST.cc:205] Error in REST request

libcurl: (51) SSL: no alternative certificate subject name matches target host name 'api.ignitionfuel.org'
```

Gazebo should be fully functional otherwise. I believe you may be conflating a different issue with this one.

> Are the debian/ubuntu hosted packages officially deprecated?

Nope, I just tested them here and they work fine except for the caveats above.

> close this ticket

This sounds reasonable to me. The issue has been fixed on later Gazebo 9 minor versions.

For Gazebo 9.0.0, which is the version upstream on Ubuntu Bionic, there's a workaround, which is to change the URL on `~/.ignition/fuel/config.yaml`:

```.diff
-     url: https://api.ignitionfuel.org
+     url: https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org
```

Note that Ubuntu Focal will ship with a later minor version of Gazebo 9 so this issue will be solved out of the box.
